channel.title: New local problems on FixMyStreet
channel.description: The latest local problems reported by users

item.title: Dead fox on drive, 15th November
item.description:
There is a large dead fox on our drive - please advise what to do
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Wood Ride, Poverest, Orpington, London Borough of Bromley
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: One side of Nutbrook Street(odd numbered houses) was cleaned of litter and leaves last week but the other side (even numbered houses) remains untouched. Is this meant to be the case? Is there a different schedule for opposite sides of the same street? Please can you arrange for the 'untouched side' of Nutbrook Street to be cleaned. It's definitely a more effective and efficient for both sides of any street to be cleaned at the same time., 15th November
item.description:
One side of Nutbrook Street(odd numbered houses) was cleaned of litter and leaves last week but the other side (even numbered houses) remains untouched. Is this meant to be the case? Is there a different schedule for opposite sides of the same street? Please can you arrange for the 'untouched side' of Nutbrook Street to be cleaned. It's definitely a more effective and efficient for both sides of any street to be cleaned at the same time. The Southwark Council website states residential streets will be cleaned every 2 days. Personally I don't think this is realisitc and you may want to review such a policy committment.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 40, Nutbrook Street, London Borough of Southwark
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Large parcel of rolled up cardboard, 15th November
item.description:
Dumped on grass verge last night, Friday 14th at 5:37pm. A large roll of corrugated cardboard packaging I have brief CCTV footage of a woman doing it and stupidly she’s left the label on it with her name and address on it (which I’ve blurred out on this photo but please contact me for it as I don’t think it’s right to put someone’s personal details on this site)

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Wallhouse Road, Slade Green, Erith, London Borough of Bexley
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Bollard placed on public land, 15th November
item.description:
A resident has placed two metal bollards to the rear of their property. I understand this is so people do not park behind their wall (not a gate that needs access) however this shouldn't be allowed as they do not own the land behind their garden wall.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Esmeralda Road, Bermondsey, London Borough of Southwark
Report on FixMyStreet
